project.teaser: CircularInvest is a CCRI-PDA initiative proposed by 4 organisations (META, INOVA+, Circle Economy and ICLEI EURO) that aims provide project development assistance (PDA) to selected circular economy (CE) project promoters from across Europe so as to access the resources needed...
project.title: Powering access to investment for next generation circular economy initiatives in cities and regions
project.keywords: Project development assistance, investment readiness, access to finance

article.title: Supporting transitions towards a sustainable circular economy

result.title: Call for EoI
result.description: D1.3. Call for EoI (M6) will be a website page where it will be available the call text, the application form, the guide for applicants, the eligibility check tool and the self-evaluation tool. It is directly linked with tasks 1.3 and 1.4;

result.title: List of mapped synergies and networking opportunities
result.description: D1.4. List of mapped synergies and networking opportunities (M3). It will map initiatives relevant for CircularInvest to collaborate, starting with CCRI-PDA and focusing to those scouted through the Partners’ network. It will set the ground for spreading the CircularInvest experience and to maximise its impact during and after the Project lifetime. It is connected with task 1.5.

result.title: CircularInvest website
result.description: D5.3. CircularInvest website (M4); the deliverable will consist in the project website which will also be the interface for applying and managing the CETAF. It will be linked with the task 5.2

result.title: Data Management Plan – first version
result.description: D6.3 Data Management Plan – first version (M6) – The deliverable will clarify methodology and tools for properly treat and manage data. It is connected to task 6.3.

result.title: Selection Procedures Guidelines
result.description: Selection Procedures Guidelines (M6) – this deliverable will summarise the main steps and criteria linked to the selection of the beneficiaries to be used for the selection of beneficiaries for the TA, including the application and the evaluation forms. It will help to verify both the eligibility and completeness of the applications, and will provide information for helping ISC to prepare the selection report. It is linked to task 1.2;

result.title: First set of promotional and informative materials
result.description: D5.2. First set of promotional and informative materials (M3): this deliverable consists in the preparation of online and offline material for the promotion of CETAF. It is connected to task 5.2 and 5.3

result.title: CETAF Operational Guidelines
result.description: The deliverable will summarise in an accessible way all the information related to the CETAF operations and it is referred to task 1.1

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CircularInvest (Powering access to investment for next generation circular economy initiatives in cities and regions)
result.teaser: Faced with the pressure to take responsibility for environmental destruction, the European Union (EU) has introduced a series of programmes, legislation, and recommendations aimed at decreasing environmental impact and expediting the transition to a more sustainable and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan– first version
result.description: D5.1. Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan – first version (M6): This deliverable will setup D&C activities clarifying tools, channels, target groups, messages, goals and KPIs of the C&D during the project lifetime towards the general public (communication) and potential users of the CSA results (dissemination). This deliverable will also provide the first draft exploitation plan for securing use of the CSA result during and after the project lifetime. It is linked to task 5.1, 5.2, 5.4 and 5.6

result.title: Project management plan
result.description: D6.1. Project management plan (M4); This deliverable will define the most important issue related to the CSA management, with tasks, roles, tools, perations and approaches. It is connected to tasks 6.1 and 6.2.

category.title: business models
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/business models

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
